newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa undecided on British submarine deal.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa undecided on British submarine deal.

text.p: The South African government has not taken a decision on a British offer of four Upholder class submarines for a knockdown price of around two billion rand ($426 million), Deputy Defence Minister Ronnie Kasrils said on Monday.
Kasrils told reporters in Cape Town that the offer was being evaluated along with tenders for four corvettes to bolster the country's small navy.
A final decision would depend on the size of the defence budget for fiscal 1997/98, a decision likely to be made by the cabinet later this month, he said.
Kasrils said the mothballed diesel-electric submarines were being offered to South Africa at "a phenomenally low price", but said the offer would not remain open for long.
